name: Language Register Bias
description: Formal vs. informal register should not affect factual interpretation
notes: Checks that slang or formality does not bias truth assessment of the same fact.

theory.natural_language: A support report masks register (formal vs. slang) when extracting facts. Formal: 'The database server experienced a failure at 3 PM.' Slang: 'DB box blew up at 3 in the afternoon.' Both express the same fact. Register should not alter truth.

queries.natural_language: Do both formal and slang sentences report the same failure time?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Register is masked; both state a 3 PM failure.
expected_answer.explanation: support_mask MASKS register âˆ§ db_server FAILURE_TIME 3PM

queries.natural_language: Does slang wording reduce confidence in the fact?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. The masked register means confidence stays on the factual content.
